main_definition: An excerpt is a selected passage or extract from a larger written work, such as a book, article, or document.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A part taken from a longer text to give an idea of the content
meanings_and_examples.example: The excerpt from J.K. Rowling's Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone gives readers a glimpse into the magical world she created.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A section or passage used for reference or analysis
meanings_and_examples.example: The excerpt on climate change in this scientific journal provides valuable data for researchers studying global warming.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An extract from a speech, often quoted to highlight an important point
meanings_and_examples.example: Nelson Mandela's famous words, 'I am the product of 22 years of dedicated work and sacrifice,' are widely known excerpts from his inaugural address.
